cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi WNW of Nassau and 180 mi SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwestern Bahamas today, then paralleling the Florida east coast and curving north-northwest toward the Georgia–South Carolina coast before turning seaward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: potential brush/landfall along the east-central Florida coast late 6 Oct–early 7 Oct; closest coastal encounter with South Carolina expected near Charleston

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Edisto Beach to South Santee River, South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast northward through Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-73 mph) are likely; hurricane-force gusts (≥74 mph) are possible during the closest approach Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible in Charleston Harbor and adjacent waterways if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with localized totals near 12 inches possible along the South Carolina coast, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal erosion expected.
